snippet: In a letter to Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr., the representatives urged him to intervene immediately in the case of the Staten Island man who died in police custody.
abstract: Six members of Congress ask United States Attorney General Eric H Holder Jr to open a federal investigation into circumstances surrounding death of Eric Garner on Staten Island while in police custody; also requests inquiry be extended into other possible civil-rights violations committed by New York Police Department.
lead_paragraph: In a letter to Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr., the representatives urged him to intervene immediately in the case of the Staten Island man who died in police custody.

headline.main: Six Members of Congress Ask Holder to Open Federal Inquiry in Chokehold Case
headline.print_headline: Six Members of Congress Ask Holder to Open Federal Inquiry in Chokehold Case
